description: Kia America is recalling nearly 463,000 Telluride SUVs — and urging owners to park their cars outside and away from other structures until an issue posing a fire hazard is fixed.
title: Kia recalls nearly 463,000 Telluride SUVs due to fire risk

description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Pratap Bhanu Mehta, a political analyst in Kolkata, about what India's latest election means for Prime Minister Modi and the country's democracy.
title: How Modi will lead with a coalition government, and what voters want

description: A training program out of Georgia was meant to move people from low-wage positions to green jobs of the future. It focused on Electric Vehicle charging and was met with enthusiasm.
title: A training program promised jobs working on EV chargers. The market hasn’t lived up

description: A professional baker in Gaza has been making cakes to celebrate life amid war. He fled an Israeli offensive in Rafah, along with nearly 1 million other Palestinians, and set up a makeshift bakery near a displaced persons camp.
title: Gaza baker flees Rafah with nearly 1 million other Palestinians

description: From Mexico to Panama and El Salvador, several recent elections in Latin America could mean a shift in migration policy and collaboration with the United States.
title: Several major elections in the Americas could impact the flow of migrants to the U.S.

description: Commercial fisheries in the Great Lakes hope to follow an example set in Iceland, by using nearly 100 percent of a fish in order to increase the value of each one landed while also decreasing waste.
title: Commercial fisheries in the Great Lakes borrow an idea to help revive their industry

description: When Chat GPT came out a year and a half ago, school districts rushed to block the tool amid fears students would use it to cheat. Now, many districts are embracing AI more broadly.
title: How AI tools are being used in classrooms

description: The NBA Finals are underway between the Boston Celtics and Dallas Mavericks. For long-suffering Boston fans, it's not been since 2008 that they last won a title. They feel like now is their time.
title: The stakes for the Boston Celtics and Dallas Mavericks in the NBA Finals

description: The saga began as a dispute over anti-Trump lawn signs and culminated in a profanity-filled confrontation on the street, which Justice Samuel Alito witnessed.
title: Alito neighbor gives detailed account of 'nasty' dispute that became national news

description: Alex Jones, who spread lies about the 2012 shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School, has dropped efforts to declare bankruptcy and avoid paying $1.5 billion in damages he owes the victims' families.
title: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones agrees to liquidate assets to pay Sandy Hook families

description: From tiny homes to big ones built in hours, the Innovative Housing Showcase highlights ways to make housing more affordable and plentiful — at a time when many Americans struggle to buy a home.
title: Homes have popped up on the National Mall - showing they can be built fast and cheap

description: New measure from the White House intends to curtail high number of immigrants attempting to cross through the Southern border
title: Would President Biden’s asylum restrictions work? It’s a short-term fix, analysts say

description: Drowning is the No. 1 cause of death for children ages 1 to 4 in the U.S. Before you take your kids to the pool or the ocean this summer, test your knowledge of drowning prevention and water safety.
title: QUIZ: Parents, how much do you know about water safety for kids?

description: The speech from Israel's prime minister is likely to be contentious, with some Democratic members of Congress already signaling plans to boycott.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu to address a joint session of Congress on July 24

description: These are the pros and cons of 10 Republicans Trump could choose for a running mate. NPR critics share their most highly anticipated TV shows of the summer.
title: Trump's potential VP candidates; NPR's summer TV picks

description: Former President Donald Trump attended an event put on by a conservative group that has growing ties to a movement that seeks to assert a stronger role for Christianity in how the country is governed.
title: Trump turns over many campaign responsibilities to outside group, Turning Point USA

description: As more people try weight-loss drugs like Wegovy, some skip the brand name and buy compounded semaglutide from online pharmacies. But some of these may not follow state and federal standards.
title: Thinking of buying Wegovy online. Here’s what to know about compounding pharmacies

description: Reactions have been brutal to Canadian writer Sam Forster, who disguised himself as a Black man and traveled the U.S. to document how racism persists in society.
title: With Maybelline Mocha and an Afro wig, white author explores 'Blackness' in a new book

description: The amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere hit an all time high in May. That trend must reverse in order to rein in climate change.
title: There is more carbon dioxide than ever in the atmosphere. That’s bad for the climate

description: In this week's StoryCorps, a woman talks with her wife about becoming the first openly gay bishop in the United Methodist Church.
title: For the first openly gay Methodist bishop, Christianity continued to be her calling

description: A 60-year-old architect from Long Island accused of killing multiple women has been charged in additional murders that took place in 1993 and 2003. Here's what to know about the decade-long investigation.
title: The Gilgo Beach killings suspect is charged with two more murders. Here's what to know

description: Psychotherapist Orna Gurlanik, star of the documentary series Couples Therapy, is challenging the idea that couples therapy is a last-ditch effort for people.
title: TV series 'Couples Therapy' gives viewers a rare look into real life therapy sessions

description: The eight employees say that since the plant opened in 1988, many systems in place have benefited white workers more than Black staff. They claim that HR has ignored “egregious incidents of racism.”
title: Black workers sue General Mills over alleged racial discrimination at a Georgia plant

description: The NTSB says an air traffic controller’s mistake led to a near collision of two jets on a runway in Texas last year. Investigators say critical safety technology might have prevented the incident.
title: Safety investigators want more technology to prevent close calls on runways

description: Over 200 U.S. Army Rangers scaled the cliffs of Pointe du Hoc on D-Day to destroy German long-range guns stationed at the top. Less than half remained standing after two days of fighting.
title: The dramatic story of Pointe du Hoc, the backdrop to Biden's D-Day anniversary speech

description: Are you up to date with the latest hot dog news? What about politics and space travel? Maybe this is the week you score a perfect 11 in the quiz.
title: Upside-down flags, $1.50 hot dogs and (Hunter) Biden news. Can you ace the quiz?

description: Will President Biden's new executive order restricting asylum at the U.S.-Mexico border change voters' minds this election year?
title: Biden’s asylum restrictions come as many voters disagree with his immigration record

description: As the West braces for excessive heat, the Phoenix Fire Department is rolling out a new protocol to treat heat stroke patients -- putting them in a bag filled with ice.
title: First responders in Phoenix are using a new treatment during heat emergencies

description: Voting is underway in the European parliamentary elections -- where a new block of voters is heading to the polls in two countries. Germany and Belgium have lowered the voting age from 18 to 16.
title: EU parliamentary election: There will be 16-year-old voters in Germany and Belgium

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with IKEA Retail U.S. President Javier Quiñones about the furniture store chain's decision to reduce its prices.
title: Why the Sweden-based company IKEA has cut prices 3 times in a year

description: Alex Jones agrees to liquidate his assets to pay Sandy Hook families. The new Washington Post publisher has tried to kill stories about him. There is more carbon dioxide than ever in the atmosphere.
title: Morning news brief

description: The two major presidential candidates have very different approaches to health policy. What are they, and how might they shape health care access over the next four years?
title: How Biden and Trump disagree over how to address the cost of health care

description: Cricket is one of the world’s most popular sports, with about 2.5 billion fans. Several of the U.S. team’s starting players are from other countries, including India, Pakistan and New Zealand.
title: The U.S. defeats Pakistan in a dramatic upset at the cricket World Cup

description: The U.S. men's team scored a big win in the cricket World Cup when it beat powerhouse Pakistan. The U.S. is co-hosting the tournament for the first time, along with the West Indies.
title: Cricket World Cup: U.S. men's team pulls of a major upset by beating Pakistan

description: Longtime Trump ally Steve Bannon is expected to seek a stay of the judge's order, which could delay his prison surrender date.
title: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon must report to prison by July 1, judge says

description: It is the most recent show of wartime support for the longtime ally despite mounting political divisions over Israel’s military assault on Hamas in Gaza.
title: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu set to address the U.S. Congress on July 24
